text.0: ten sisters pouring out the rain together swiftmoving thinkers of the sage adorn him.
text.1: hither hath run the goldhued child of sūrya and reached the vat like a fleet vigorous courser.
text.2: even as a youngling crying to his mothers the bounteous steer hath flowed along to waters.
text.3: as youth to damsel so with milk he hastens on to the chose meetingplace the beaker.
text.4: yea swollen is the udder of the milchcow thither in streams goes very sapient indu.
text.5: the kine make ready as with newwashed treasures the head and chief with milk within the vessels.
text.6: with all the gods o indu pavamana while thou art roaring send us wealth in horses.
text.7: hither upon her car come willing plenty inclined to us to give us of her treasures.
text.8: now unto us mete riches while they cleansethee allglorious swelling wealth with store of heroes.
text.9: long be his life who worships thee o indu may he enriched with prayer come soon and early.
